page.title: 08Types of Cattle on the Farm.
page.content: Mr.Weaver breeds Friesian and Limousin cattle on his farm at Park Lane,Endon.He has fifty Limousin cows and one prize bull valued at ten thousand pounds and weighing just over a ton.Mr.Weaver brought his first Limousins over from France four years ago.He likes this breed because they give an average of 7.5% more meat than other breeds with very little gristle. The Limousins are a pedigree breed and they are kept outside all the year round.In winter they are fed on barley. Friesian heifers are bought and the calves are bred.The cows are fed on beef mix and silage. Mr.Weaver uses the cattle market at nearby Leek when he wants to buy or sell stock.He has had plenty of success with his cattle at agricultural shows,winning many prizes.
